snippet: Entrepreneurs and small aerospace companies based at an air and space port in California are among those thought to be leading the next phase of space exploration.
lead_paragraph: MOJAVE, Calif. -- The sign into town, slightly weathered, says ''Gateway to Space!'' Beyond it lies the Mojave Air and Space Port, once a Marine auxiliary air station during World War II, now an incubator for the tinkerers and dreamers in the New Space movement. Adherents believe that the next phase of space exploration will be led by nimble, ambitious entrepreneurs -- a new generation of people like Bill Hewlett and Dave Packard, who helped create the electronics industry in a garage -- and that this is their moment to come together and make it happen.

headline.main: In California Desert, a Town On the Way Up ... to Space
